title: Artist Profile: Dan Brown
content:
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Daniel, Dan, or Danny Brown is the name of:

  • Danny Brown (rapper) (born 1981), American hip hop recording artist
  • Daniel Q. Brown ( fl. 1960s-70s), American Old Catholic bishop
  • Daniel Russell Brown (1848–1919), American politician, governor of Rhode Island
  • Dee Brown (basketball, born 1984) (Daniel Brown), American basketball player
  • Danny Brown (American football) (1925–1995), American football defensive end
  • Danny Brown (footballer) (born 1980), English footballer
  • Danny Joe Brown (1951–2005), American musician
  • Dan Brown (born 1990) British artist, based in Bristol
  • Dan Brown (born 1964), American author of thriller fiction, including The Da Vinci Code
  • Dan Brown (YouTube) (born 1990), American internet blogger and YouTube celebrity
  • Dan W. Brown (born 1950), Republican member of the Missouri Senate
  • Daniel Brown (politician), city councilman and acting mayor of the city of Knoxville, Tennessee

See also

  • Daniel Browne (born 1979), rugby union player from New Zealand
  • Dan Browne (born 1974), American distance runner
  • Dan Braun (born 1961), American musician

The Dan Brown I’m gonna talk about (if you haven’t guessed) is the Bristol Based artist, who is doing some very exciting things, by comparison to novel writing or playing football, like his other namesakes.

This Dan Brown, explores the relationship between art in the virtual world, and art in the physical world. Challenging our relationship with technology and what it means to consistently live with and maintain our own virtual counterparts. Looking at the crossover, art that can exist both online and in reality, using this concept, creating virtual objects or images that act as a teaser or preview for the physical object that will be revealed.

His “Ad Hoc” Advertising Campaign is a brutal and hilarious example of this relationship in action. Hyping up and building the anticipation for his latest project www.thevirtualdegreeshow.com

Dan is currently about to become a resident artist in Philadelphia Street, Bristol. As a part of The New Collective and their Summer Residency and Exhibition Program, so keep an eye out for the resulting exhibition, it’s going to be a good one!
